Reviews.Title: “Good value London Inn”
Reviews.Author: johnsons365
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to this hotel by long time family friends who at one time lived in London and still have ties ties to the University. They stay here when in town. Our stay was very satisfactory, we had to family suite, 2 adults and children, with private bath. They served a proper English breakfast, a big hit with the kids. The room was clean and the young staff friendly. The location was handy to the tube, there was a nice market nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Small traditional and good value”
Reviews.Author: Hullkid
Reviews.Content: I stay here one weekend every year and I'm always very happy. Small traditional in a quiet part of London but only minutes from Euston/Kings Cross. I would say it would be hard to better the value when it's working out at £40 per person.

Reviews.Title: “will stay there again any time (unless I win the lottery)”
Reviews.Author: celik_ankara
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location with the feel of a small bed and breakfast. Even though I'm a little obsessive compulsive, the bathroom facilities were so clean I didn't mind sharing. Very friendly staff. Reliable breakfast. Couldn't be better for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and inexpensive - and quiet hotel near Euston”
Reviews.Author: MichaelH62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spotlessly clean and iffers basic accommodation and a good breakfast. The rooms are quiet

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: seattlefan111
Reviews.Content: Booked small room to be near British Library. I found location to be very interesting - Euston Road, St.Pancras etc. a few blocks away very busy and great for transportation, but as soon as you get off those streets relative quiet, pubs, restaurants, grocery stores, quirky shops and a nice little new shopping centre a few blocks toward Russell tube stop. The stairs are steep, and I had a room with a shower and sink and bathroom down the hall. There was never anyone in either of the bathroom or shower room down the hall. The owner is very friendly and helpful, and breakfast and staff were both well organized and good. Walking distance from British Museum as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: DIG1991
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November following 4* description on website. This is a guest house in need of modernisation. No lifts, so be prepared for a long haul up narrow staircase if you are above ground floor. Whilst our room was clean, the en-suite shower room was very disappointing - very dated, no heater, poor ventilation. Creaky floorboards in adjoining rooms do nothing to aid sleep. Breakfast (served in a very small room in the basement) was OK but bacon and/or sausage on successive days had not been freshly prepared and tea bags are at a premium! The location - equidistant from Euston/St Pancras and Russell Square tube - is great as is access to local shops, pubs, museums (British Museum and British Library, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Charmingly good value”
Reviews.Author: Planningmyhols
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on a theatre trip. Had room 7 on the ground floor. Good size room charmingly furnished and very clean. Tiny shower and loo with a sliding door which doesn't quite close so you need to trust the person you're with but reasonably clean. Nice touch was free computer in lovely sitting room. Breakfast served in basement was good. Nice quite location in a London crescent - you can even use the gardens or tennis courts opposite. All in all very good value for a London hotel in a good location (10 mins walk KX or Euston).

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gepang
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the crescent hotel from 30/10/2011 to 02/11/2011 in a double room with ensuite bathroom. the hotel is very conveniently located: we arrived at king's cross with the underground, then it took only a few minutes to reach the hotel. it is located in the cartwright gardens, so it's very quite. we had a room at the second floor (there is no lift): it was clean, with a quite confortable bed and a quite large bathroom. the breakfast was very good: they served english breakfast cooked to order and continental breakfast at the buffet. we only had to wait a few minutes to get a table. the underground stop of russel square is 4-5 minute walk. definitly a good choice in london!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: LyndsayF
Reviews.Content: London hotels are incredibly expensive and your money doesn't seem to get you very far. The hotel represents very good value for money and is in a very central location. I felt quite safe at night in the neighbourhood. The breakfast and coffee was excellent and the room was very clean with wooden floors. On the downside, there was a horrid damp smell on the basement corridor on the way to my room, but fortunately no smell within the actual room itself. The fire alarm also went off at 430am one night and rather disconcertingly the staff informed me that it had been activated from my room. Being an ardent non-smoker with no evidence of actual smoke or fire within the room, I found this a little disconcerting that the fire alarm could simply go off at such an hour. I found it difficult to get back to sleep and consequently had to miss the first few hours of my course the following day. Electrical faults do happen, but it would have been nice to apologise to guests (including me!) on their check-out - this didn't happen. The room was also slightly cold as the radiator hadn't been bled in a while. Also the staff could be a little more friendly - after arriving at the hotel at 2am due to a horrendously delayed train journey, I found the housekeeper rather gruff and actually found myself apologising for inconveniencing her (even though technically guests at hotels should be entitled to check in whenever they wish). It would have been nice to have acknowledged my delay, asked if everything was ok and not made me feel that I needed to apologize. All in all though, good value and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuginSD
Reviews.Content: Good location, conveniently located near Russell Square tube station. Room was a good value compared to other hotels in London, however on check in the bathroom was dirty with hair in the shower drain, shower curtain was dirty and smelled like mildew. Otherwise the room was cleaned daily, staff was nice, but not helpful with recommendations on things which were nearby. I feel this was simply because they didn't know not that they didn't want to help. Stay includes a full breakfast which is a good way to start the day and save you some money. There are other restaurants located a short walk away. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: cky2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in Sept/October. The hotel is located in a safe locality between Russell Sq and Euston underground stations so is very convenient and allows for flexibility in planning tube trips. Our room and bathroom were clean and comfortable albeit a bit old. The breakfast was quite good with a good variety of food. The staff were friendly and there is free internet access at the computer in the front room or wi-fi at reasonable rates. Luggage could also be left at the office after check out. Fortunately we had a room on the 1st floor otherwise lugging our luggage up several floors would be a challenge since there is no lift. All in all a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: lwright_16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights in September 2011 and it was great. The room was clean, although a bit older, but comfortable. All of the staff were very helpful as I asked a lot of questions on how to get places and where to find things. The breakfast was good and filling. I would definitely recommend this place for a nice quiet place to tour London from. Locale is great for British Museum and tube and train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Bluesun614
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was safe, clean and comfortable. The staff was very polite and helpful. We arrived early and a room was made available to us very quickly. The breakfast was very good. The rooms are small but comfortable. The hotel is in a very central location, very close to St. Pancreas Station and to the British Museum. It is on a quiet street with a small park across. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable Hotel in Cental London”
Reviews.Author: mes98nd
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Crescent because of its proximity to Senate House where my husband was attending a conference. It was also recommended in Frommer's "London with Families." Our room was a bit outdated, but clean. We were lucky it was not hot, as the hotel was not air conditioned. We asked at reception for a fan for the room, which they were able to provide. The room included a full English breakfast, which was nice. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. My two complaints: the bed was uncomfortable. Also, we asked them to arrange a car to the airport (which was listed as a provided service in the hotel's amenities book). It took them a couple days, then it wasn't clear to us whether they had included a car seat for our toddler so we wanted to confirm with reception on Saturday (car was coming at 6am on Sunday morning). Even though signs state that Reception is open from 7:30am to 10pm, Reception was closed for almost 2 hours Saturday afternoon. The most annoying part was that we could hear music and talking coming from behind the door (where the "be right back" sign was hanging). They also didn't answer the phone when we called from the room. Later in the day, we were able to get help and get the car service confirmed, but it was frustrating to say the least. Overall, it's a good hotel and VERY affordable, especially for a nice location in Central London. The hotel was only a 10-minute walk to a tube station, which made it easy to get around. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: golfmalaga
Reviews.Content: after having to leave a previous hotel due to the disgraceful condition of the rooms, we managed to find this hotel.with a spare room on the third floor,no lift of course due to london regulations. luckily the man in charge ,a slovak i think was very helpful and willing .and carried our two cases uo p three flights of difficult stairs,and back again in the morning,for an overnight stay,close to st.pancras this proably the best bet in the cartwright gardens,and i have stayed at another 2 in same gardens.breakfast not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home in a wonderful neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Fearless17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the nights of july 6th and 7th. IT was a very easy walk to the translation of Kings Cross and St. Panaceas. The hotel is located in what I feel to be the b set neighborhood in all of London. There is even an authentic fish & chips place on the next street! Inside the rooms are beautiful and spacious and theres a free computer to use. The breakfast was a traditional English one it was delicious- and free! The underground station of Russell Square is a 2 min walk from Crescent and it takes you everywhere in the city for a $3 a day pass! It is a 20 min walk to the Thames and its a great walk for after dinner (even our 8 year old walked it there and back). There is no doubt in my mind we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find.”
Reviews.Author: miniknitwit
Reviews.Content: A really friendly welcome, helpful staff, & good service. Nice rooms with all thats needed for a comfortable stay. Within easy walking distance to some really nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: bry244
Reviews.Content: Travelled with 2 11yr olds staying in a family room. I am very careful when booking a hotel, always check out trip advisor beforehand and glad I did. Great location 10mins walk from Kings X.Received a very warm welcome from Svetlana, were able to leave our bags at 10am in a secure room which saved us Â£8 per bag at left luggage at Kings X. Very clean and quiet, fabulous breakfast, great staff, were told they had a lot of regulars, can see why, we will add to thier growing list.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: PalettePalatePlate
Reviews.Content: Everything you need, really, for a weekend in London without busting the budget. My room was small, but clean, with a sink in room, two towels, tea/coffee in room, desk and a TV with 3 channels. The floorboards creak so you can hear your neighbor, but that really shouldn't scare anyone off, I hope. I elected to share the toilet/shower because I'd rather spend the money I'd save on London somethings; I only had to wait once; the shower was spotless. Breakfast was a good solid start to the day--English breakfast, porridge, cereals are available. It was all perfectly pleasant. If you want luxury, the feeling of being special, and a bit of London glam, this isn't for you, but if you are looking for a clean, well-located, and pleasant place to sleep while exploring London, this is really ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: TravelistaCA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crescent because a friend had recommended it. It certainly has a good location but I found the hotel somewhat lacking. The rooms were very big but tired looking and the beds were very hard and uncomfortable. The TV reception was almost non-existant. Although I watch little TV when on vacation, being able to watch the news would have been nice. The staff was not rude but nor were they friendly. I doubted they really cared about a return visit from me.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Happy Here”
Reviews.Author: btgm
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I have stayed at the Crescent Hotel. Each time it has been clean, breakfast has been good, and the staff is friendly. I find it to be a very convenient location. You can walk to Euston Station, Kings Cross/St Pancras, and Russell Square tube stations in about 5-10 min. It is easy to get to on the Picadilly line from Heathrow. My original review was in Oct 2008, and that all still applies except I have not ever had mold on the shower curtain again. This time we arrived into Heathrow late, and didn't get to the hotel until midnight or 1AM. Reception is closed by then, but we rang the bell outside and staff came to let us in within 2-3 minutes. They were perfectly friendly and did not make us feel we were putting them out by arriving so late. I have stayed here 3 times with my daughter (aged 10-12) and once alone and felt safe all of the times. The prices seem to be very reasonable. They have a computer in the lounge with internet access for free, but it is frequently occupied (although we have always been able to use it, people don't seem to stay on it too long). You have to pay for wifi in the room, but I think it was only 6 or 10 Â£ for the whole stay (I can't remember exactly). They do change the code on Sundays, so make sure you get the new code if you are there over a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, accommodating staff, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Schuylkill
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this bed and breakfast over 40 times since the 1980's. It is family run, by the second generation of owners. My room is comfortable, with modern amenities (wi fi, phone, telly ...). The Crescent is reasonably priced, and includes an English breakfast where you can meet people from all over the world. The location is superb (near Euston and St. Pancras Stations, as well as the Russell Square underground), within walking distance of the British Library, British Museum, and West End. Nearby buses run to the South Bank. Around the corner is a laundromat, and there are scores of nearby restaurants. This is a superb establishment.

Reviews.Title: “It's a fine place to stay as a tourist visiting London”
Reviews.Author: MiBo
Reviews.Content: My goal was to stay at a B&B-style hotel, and the Crescent Hotel worked out fine. I would definitely stay again. It's in a quite area. There are hospitals nearby, so you might hear ambulances. Our room was small, but we didn't ask for anything large. A room with two twin beds and en suite toilet, sink and shower was just right. Wireless internet is available, but you must pay six pounds for three days' use. Breakfast had a fine assortment of typical English choices. There are two underground stations nearby, quite convenient, both on the Picadilly line to Heathrow. Plus, being close to St. Pancras Kings Cross means being close to the trains. The office provided a safe deposit box for free, large enough for passports or iPods but not large enough for a laptop computer. For a short stay there are enough restaurants, pubs and stores around the corner. The price for a room was Â£100 per night. While high in general, this is typical for central London, so my score for value is relative to the rates I saw for similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Comfortable Enough”
Reviews.Author: WanderWhy
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have stated, the location is perfect â€“ near two stations and within walking distance of the British Museum. Our room, a triple with bathroom (shower only), was comfortable and quite large, but there seems to be a variety of room sizes. The hotel offers some sense of staying in a British home. The internet was down one day, a British Telecom problem that affected a wide area. Disadvantages: no lift and the breakfast room was crowded and sometimes full.

Reviews.Title: “I would go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: eclipsethecat
Reviews.Content: We booked the Crescent Hotel based on it's review in Frommers and because my Husband knew the area very well. I was disappointed from the moment we walked in the front door. First of all there was someone cleaning the windows above the front door. He didnt stop to let us in and I got drenched with water dragging my bags in the door. Then the Russian/Eastern European woman who works the front desk coldly told us we would have to wait until 2:30 to check in because she "wasn't sure if the room was ready." I was hot annoyed and sweaty from being on the plane and dragging my bags all over town, so the last thing I wanted on my honeymoon was a rude front desk girl. It only went down from there- the staff is rude- in fact Mrs Cockrel herself was blatantly rude to myself and my husband, the computer room (while nice it is provided) is always full, the beds are hard as rocks and they didnt change the sheets while we were there. They also have very very hard towels and the ones that we were given that were "clean" had black smudges all over them. Another annoying thing is that there is rarely anyone at the desk- and forget it if you need someone before 7:00 or after 10:00- we had to make an emergency call because we needed to check out early, so we called at 10:30 and the girl who answered acted like we had called her in the middle of her wedding. The rooms were larger though, and we didnt have any problems with the water flow. The breakfast was nice, but not worth the other shortcomings that this hotel has. There were many many other hotels along the Crescent so I would check those out before I booked here. OH! And it is SUPER loud here. I was awakened by both people above us pounding around and the people who were outside.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good value”
Reviews.Author: Flater
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located between three tube stations (King's Cross, Russel Sq and Euston Sq). The hotel is clean and adequately furnished. It's no luxury, but it is sufficient for a few days of London. The breakfast - freshly cooked to order - is one of its strong points, another being the friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “it's tiny and the attached shower doesn't work well”
Reviews.Author: Jassym
Reviews.Content: Cartwright Gardens has many hotels. This had to be the worst of the lot. First of all, the steps to get to my room on the 3rd level were very steep and I was always afraid of tumbling downwards. The room itself was tiny, with a sink and shower attached. I couldn't use the shower as the water was never hot enough and looks like it badly needs updating. The shower head directed the water all over the place but downwards. In effect, I had to use the shared facilities instead which were alot more luxurious. There was also no wifi but there was internet access at a computer terminal on the ground floor. On a positive note, the breakfast was respectable and the staff were friendly and accomodating. The breakfast room is also very cosy and charming. The views of the garden was quite relaxing as well. In terms of location, Cartwright Gardens can be easily reached from the Russell Square tube station, or Euston, or Kings' Cross. Along Marchmont Street, the very modernised Brunswick Centre has loads of dining and shopping options. In all, I think one would be better off spending a little more and staying at any of the adjacent hotels or at Tavistock or Russell Squares.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: NYCFamilyTravelers
Reviews.Content: The Crescent Hotel is well located and perfectly fine for the money. Our room was big by London standards, clean and had a TV. The included breakfast ends too early - 9am - for people on vacation which was disappointing. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: msjude
Reviews.Content: i spent a total of 10 nights at the Crescent, in August and September of 2008, and on the whole was very satisfied. It's a 2-star hotel, about 75 pounds a night for a single with bath. The rooms were very clean. I was relieved to see my first room was spacious enough, and had a big window onto a small courtyard. Everything was adequate, there was a kettle for making coffee or tea, and a small tv. The bed was comfortable. A week later I stayed again for two nights. They didn't have a room with bath available, and the single room they put me in was very small, at 50 pounds per night. The next night I was moved to a larger room with bath, but when I saw a mouse, I moved back to the smaller room. The women at the front desk were nice, but didn't have a lot of knowledge about tourist-type questions. The breakfast was very good - you can get a full English breakfast with eggs, sausage, bacon, beans, tomato, toast, and there were cereals and fruits on the sideboard. Just down the block is an excellent fish and chips restaurant called North Sea Fish, just across Marchmont on Leigh Street. There are other restaurants and pubs and grocery stores all within two or three blocks, and the Russell Square Tube is about four blocks down Marchmont. Also, you can catch many buses at Russell Square, about five blocks away, including the Big Bus Tour, which I would recommend. London is so big, the tour takes about four hours. You can get on and off as you please. One note of warning. Never, EVER, attempt, under any circumstances, in this life or the next, to drive in London. We rented a car to go to Devon for a week - and it was entirely possible that we could have spent that whole week just trying to navigate out of London. Every two blocks, the road names change, you encounter a roundabout with indecipherable signs, and don't know where the heck to turn off! It's a nightmare. It would be far better to take a train or bus out of London and rent a car from another town. Jude Mayer, Shabbona, Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Great little London hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieDavies
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in September and was pleasantly surprised. It is about a 5 minute walk from both Euston and St Pancras and is set in a rather pretty tree lined crescent. I arrived about 12.30 and having read on the website that it was ok to leave luggage on your arrival and departure dates thought I would just leave my bag. But I received a very warm welcome and was told my room was ready. However two minutes later I was informed 'ooops no it isn't' but "we have another one that is ready if you are happy to stay on the third floor." My single en suite room contained a double and a single bed! I was very happy to spread out with all that space. The third floor was quite a trek up and there is no lift, but it was a lovely room. There is a dressing table/desk, a fan (a godsend in London!), tv on a unit and more than adequate tea/coffee/hot chocolate supplies. Irons, hairdryers, dressing gowns are all available from reception. I was given a room key and a front door key. There are tennis courts and gardens available opposite for guest use. There is a lounge with a computer with free internet access. Breakfast was plentiful and rather nice. Usually in London I am very distrustful of little independent hotels and stay in one of the chains where I know what to expect - but this room that was booked for me was a very pleasant unexpected surprise and I will certainly be staying here again. One last point is that although the hotel was full the noise was minimal - and I slept with the windows open and still the noise was minimal even from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I could have ever expected”
Reviews.Author: rnetzley
Reviews.Content: The Crescent was one of the hotels suggested by a conference I attended at the University of London. I was initially wary of it, mainly because it was so much cheaper than the other options and only had shared bathroom rooms available when I booked. Plus, when I first arrived, it turned out that there were loads of American undergraduate students staying in the area. I must say, though, that the Crescent was a fabulous experience: sure, the room was a tad small, particular for Americans raised on gigantic rooms, but it was absolutely quiet and the broadband connection worked consistently throughout. The English breakfast was fine, but there's a great patisserie around the corner if one prefers a lighter breakfast. And considering the locale, the price was just unbeatable: I stayed for two weeks at only 49 pounds a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Bloomsbury”
Reviews.Author: RW_Architect
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to find the Crescent Hotel which could provide our family of 4 with an economical family room for our 3 nights in London. The Bloomsbury section of London was ideal with its many restaurants, parks, and easy access to tube and rail stations. The hotel is in two historic townhouses which gives it great character. Our room was a high-ceiling first floor room. We discovered the first night that it was a little noisy from sidewalk conversations to sleep with the window cracked open. The room was comfortable with a bathroom, shower, TV, and phone. Because the entire hotel eats breakfast at the same time (it being included), we found that the hot water for showering often ran out in the morning. It was there if we got up earlier or took an evening shower. The breakfasts were generous English breakfasts of satisfactory quality. The hotel has a TV lounge with a computer available for guest use; which was so great to research tourist information. There's a little garden available for guest use. The park in front of the hotel has tennis courts that are available for guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Crescent Hotel: warm hospitality, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ReaderWriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crescent for six nights at the beginning and end of our Great Britain trip. We would stay there again without any hesitation and would recommend it to friends. The guest care is excellent, the staff very responsive and professional. The breakfast choices are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable economical London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheapskatetourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about ten days in May 2008. All in all, a good budget hotel in one of the most expensive cities in the world. I paid 49 pounds per night for a single, with shower and sink in the room, toilet down the hall. Room "compact" with little storage other than a wardrobe and desk with 4 shallow drawers. Noise was rarely a problem, as the hotel is on a crescent and the traffic is mostly on the main road which is 100 yards away. In the crescent is a park with tennis courts. On a warm Saturday night there was a lot of partying in the park, otherwise peaceful. Room fairly clean, as were bathrooms. Good full English breakfast (eggs, bacon sausage, beens, tomato, as well as hot and cold cereal, orange juice, yogurt, fruit) included. Hotel people generally helpful. I arrived at 11 PM, tired. Man at the desk brought my bag up to the room, did not wait for a tip. As I was on the fourth floor (American, 3rd floor European), and the last flight of stairs was steep and narrow, I was appreciative. What not to like? They advertised Internet access in the room, which they provide with a plug in cord that apparently runs on a wireless signal. Well, there is insufficient signal on the top floor. They do provide free a computer in the lounge, which unfortunately was broken for the first few days of my stay.. They did not charge me for the wireless cord, since it did not work. Since private Internet access is quite important to me, was a big problem. I had e-mailed before arrival and asked for a lower floor room. I never heard back and did not follow up (my mistake), so of course I ended up on the top floor. Since I'm an older traveler, a nuisance but still a problem. Overall, if you want basic economical, clean, convenient accomodations fairly close to Underground and in central London, this is a good choice. Not for person with trouble with stairs (no elevator), perhaps not if Internet access is important, but for most a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value, service.”
Reviews.Author: namaste246
Reviews.Content: Located in the Bloomsbury section, close to three tube stations, within walking distance to the British Museum and the British Library, this b&b gives great value in a pleasant setting. The staff is cheerful and courteous. There is a scumptious English breakfast served. Rooms are a bit on the small side and bathrooms are OK but need some updating. One of the main attractions is that the hotel is quiet, located away from heavy traffic. There are many inexpensive restaurants and a mini mall closeby. What made my stay here really memorable was that I left a fairly valuable pair of binoculars in a dresser in the room. Within a day after I telephoned the hotel from New York. they e-mailed to let me know that they had found it and mailed it to my NY address within a week. Bravo Hotel Crescent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and nice price”
Reviews.Author: archie110
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near Kings Cross and the British Museum. It is on a quiet street. The hotel isn't too big, and the breakfast was large and yummy. My room was small, but it is London, and most of the room was taken up by the bed--though there was a high ceiling. There was also a small TV. The bed was comfortable. The price was right, recommended for an affordable stay in London

HotelInfo.Name: Crescent Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 49-50 Cartwright Gardens | Bloomsbury, London WC1H 9EL, England
